roleset.name: wow someone by exceeding expectations, be impressive

role.descr: instrument or manner, if in addition to arg0

example.name: impress-v: oddly intransitive
example.text: Some shows just don't impress, he says, and this is one of them.

example.name: impress-v: simple transitive
example.text: That impressed Robert B. Pamplin, Georgia-Pacific's chief executive at the time, whom Mr. Hahn had met while fundraising for the institute.
example.arg: Robert B. Pamplin, Georgia-Pacific's chief executive at the time, whom Mr. Hahn had met while fundraising for the institute.

example.name: impress-v: passive with 'with'
example.text: Michael Burns, president of Telesystems, says his concern has only benefited from the publicity surrounding the case, noting that three other charities have signed on as clients because they-1 were impressed *trace*-1 with the amount he raised for National Children's.
example.arg: with the amount he raised for National Children's.

example.name: impress-v: with instrument
example.text: [Messrs. Guber and Peters]-1 assiduously courted the man's widow for months, *trace*-1 showing her a tape of ``Gorillas in the Mist'' *trace*-1 to impress her with the quality of their work.
example.arg: with the quality of their work.

example.name: impressed-j: args0, 1
example.text: I have to say I 'm quite impressed with what I saw , if he sticks at it he 'll be a champ in the next few years .

example.name: impressive-j: with EXT
example.text: `` The record of companies that have diversified is n't all that impressive , '' he says .

example.name: impressive-j: with arg0, arg1, CAU
example.text: Heat coach Erik Spoelstra says James' scoring streak has been more impressive to him because James isn't solely focused on scoring.
example.arg: because James isn't solely focused on scoring.

example.name: impressive-j: args 0, 2
example.text: He was impressive with his razor-sharp singing and concise acting.
example.arg: with his razor-sharp singing and concise acting.

roleset.note: IMPRESS-V NOTES: Reserve use of arg2 for only those cases where there's also a stated subject (arg0). Otherwise the agent/instrumentdistinction gets impossible. (from impress.01-v)
IMPRESSED-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT-1,impress-v.01. Corresponds to VNcls amuse-31.1. (from impressed.01-j)
IMPRESSIVE-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on WSJ data, impress-v.01. Corresponds to VNcls amuse-31.1. (from impressive.01-j)

If an instrument separate from arg0 appears, please add the role in accordance with the verb frame. I'm fairly certain that such instances will not be treed as adjectives, however. (from impressed.01-j)

roleset.name: convince of importance

example.name: impress on
example.text: ``It impresses upon ordinary, young Filipinos that there's nothing to feel inferior about in using their own language,'' says Randy David, a sociologist and host of a popular television talk show.
example.arg: that there's nothing to feel inferior about in using their own language,''

roleset.note: IMPRESS-V NOTES: Frames file for 'impress' based on sentences in wsj and automatic expansion via verbnet. (from impress.02-v predicate notes)

example.name: impression-n: Arg1,0 (impression of)
example.text: This is just my impression of the site layout.

example.name: impression-n: Arg0,1 (impression on)
example.text: my experience with the CIA left, I would say, a very negative impression on me.
